channel.title: Googlechrome on travis jeffery
channel.description: Recent content in Googlechrome on travis jeffery

item.title: Disable microphone muting when typing in Google+ Hangouts
item.description:
In Terminal.app, copy-and-paste and run:

defaults write com.google.googletalkplugind exps -string [\"-tm\"]

item.title: When Google Chrome won't open iTunes links
item.description:
Recently ran into this issue where Google Chrome wouldn’t open iTunes links (e.g. links to WWDC videos, iOS apps, songs, etc.), a while ago I’d set Chrome to remember not open those links (oops).

Rather than blowing away all your settings in Chrome, here’s the fix:

  1. Open up this file ~/Library/Application Support/Google/Chrome/Local State
  2. Find the line containing either itms or itmss and delete it. The line will be something like: "itms": true,.
  3. Quit and reopen Chrome
  4. Wa-Lah!

item.title: Web Inspector's new dock to right feature
item.description:
Chrome released a new Web Inspector feature called Dock to right. This feature allows you to vertically split your screen, with your web page on the left, and Web Inspector tools on the right. If you work on a widescreen, then you’ll love this feature.

To enable the feature, open the Web Inspector, click on the gear icon at the bottom right of the Web Inspector, and check off Dock to right. Chrome made this feature available in the stable channel on Mar 28 in v18. So you probably have the feature already and if not, just update to get it.
